Package tripleplay.ui

Class Composite<T extends Composite<T>>

java.lang.Object
tripleplay.ui.Element<T>
tripleplay.ui.Container<T>
tripleplay.ui.Composite<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Element<?>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HistoryGroup, Scroller, Tabs
public abstract class Composite<T extends Composite<T>> extends Container<T>
A container with a fixed list of children, which client code must assume is immutable. Subclasses may or may not expose the children directly. Subclasses may layout via the Layout system or roll their own. TODO: why not remove the publicly exposed mutating methods in Container instead of throwing exceptions here?

    • stylesheet

      public Stylesheet stylesheet()
      Description copied from class: Container
      Returns the stylesheet associated with this container, or null. Styles are resolved by searching up the container hierarchy. Only Container actually provides styles to its children.
